result.execSummary:
The defendant Dequonn E Coleman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Adjudged Delinquent Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Same as probation conditions, exception is the condition time.

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample, pay surcharge.
Pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, fees, assessments and costs by the end of probation period. Any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment.
If revoked, all financial obligations to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of prison funds.  Balance as condition  of Extended Supervision.  Any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment.
Obtain employment and/or school equal to 40 hours per week.  Obtain high school diploma, GED or HSED.
Defendant informed he may not possess and/or own any firearms or body armor; also informed he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been reinstated.
Obtain AODA assessment.  Complete follow up care/treatment.  Cooperate with random urine screens.  DOC to test at least once per month or more.

timeConds.notes: Consecutive.  Straight time.  No release privileges. Good time allowed.  HOC work assignments allowed.  No electronic monitoring.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dequonn E Coleman

records.addlTxt: CORRECTION: Sentencing entry of 5/26/2016 reflects court reporter: Laurell Breslow-Collien, corrected from Karen Sigl (Keto), per Court Reporting Services.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Denying Defendant's Request for Release Privileges, signed and filed.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Conen, Br. 30, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request for Huber privileges.

Attorney Bridget Joy Krause in court, defendant Dequonn E Coleman not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for return on warrant.    Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Matter set for sentencing on May 26, 2016 at 1:30pm in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Deputy Court Clerk tg
No reply from defendant or surety. JM
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Discharge Summary Report received and filed.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($200.00) gj

Attorney Bridget Joy Krause in court.  Defendant, Dequonn E Coleman, does NOT appear in court.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for sentencing.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.  The Court ordered the $200 cash bail on deposit is forfeited.
Deputy Court Clerk tg
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report (positive drug test), received and filed.

Defendant Dequonn E Coleman in court with Attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a plea hearing.  As to plea:  AS TO COUNT #1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms or body armour. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  

Matter set for sentencing on March 17, 2016 at 1:30pm in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

03-12-15

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 07.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.

Defendant Dequonn E Coleman in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Dequonn E Coleman in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
